Description: Plastic female head serving as a foot of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery vessel, possibly a kernos; white slip; from top: top of head flat, smooth and undecorated; headress with part of maeander pattern above row of dots and squares with added red centres; painted facial features and lotus flower in right hand and pressed to her chest; necklace of raised dots; traces of black billet and dot pattern on vertical edge of garment; traces of brown lines for ear, hair and garment; back and underside of bust glazed streaky black.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.497 and Boston 88.926.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1382)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2191) (phase 2)
